text: Elias James "E.J." Corey (born July 12, 1928) is an American chemist. He won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for his theory of organic synthesis. Corey was born in Mathuen, Massachusetts. His parents were Lebanese immigrants. He studied at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1928 births Category:Living people Category:American chemists Category:Scientists from Massachusetts Category:American Christians Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:American inventors Category:Foreign Members of the Royal Society Category:Harvard University alumni Category:Harvard University faculty Category:Lebanese Christians Category:Maronites Category:Massachusetts Institute of Technology alumni Category:Nobel Prize in Chemistry winners
title: Elias James Corey
